summary.Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (robotics)
summary.Presentation:
To grow our R&D team, we are looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to support the development of the next iteration of our first product. 
 
About Seasony

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
To grow our R&D team, we are looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to support the development of the next iteration of our first product. 

 

About Seasony 

Seasony helps vertical farms feed the world with less hassle and more automation 

By automating the core processes in vertical farming with our modular autonomous mobile robot “Watney” we can offer vertical farms substantial reductions on labor costs and increase yields by increased monitoring. As Watney provides a platform for further automation we have created an open ecosystem for module development, that provides a one-size fits all solution for vertical farms. Together with Watney, we are building a platform that allows a seamless operational experience when setting up automation or browsing through data. The goal – to control everything through a simple, well - designed web app. 

 

About the position: 

You will work with our mobile robot consisting of a mobile platform, a lifting module, and a modular top platform to develop new features for autonomous operation in a vertical farming environment. This position is focused on working closely together with experienced mechanical engineers and interns in a fast paced, fast-moving startup where you develop your skills in an accelerated manner. You will be working primarily in Solidworks together with our lead mechanical engineer to design components for the mobile robot and create technical drawings of high fidelity for manufacturing. You will also find and source components from key suppliers whom you will be in direct contact with. We are looking for someone who wants to take responsibility for their work and can be proud of their results. You should as well have an eye for detail and be curious to solve new challenges while being able to design for safety. 

  • Lead subsystem designs for robotic products 

  • Work with cross-functional teams to refine engineering specifications, deliver designs within schedule constraints and verify designs against acceptance criteria. 

  • Collaborate with other engineers to integrate subsystem designs with overall product 

  • Work with CE, ISO and EN responsibilities in the mechanical design and implement procedures for continuous compliance 

  • Produce thorough documentation of concepts, designs, analysis, testing and processes 

  • Develop new concepts and perform feasibility analysis on designs while considering constraints from multiple disciplines (electrical design, manufacturing, business needs) 

  • Create CAD models, drawings, and specifications for parts and assemblies 

  • Troubleshoot issues, determine root causes, design and implement corrective and preventative solutions for all stages of development including production 

 

Must have: 

  • Minimum BSME and 5+ years of relevant experience  

  • 5+ years of industry experience in a professional and product-driven environment 

  • Development of complex products through trade studies or system design and analysis 

  • Hands-on expertise in mechanism design, electro-mechanical actuators, sensors, or mobile robotic platforms 

  • Expertise with Creo or SolidWorks, advanced assemblies, part design for various manufacturing (machining, 3D printing, molding, sheet metal, etc.) and CTF drawings with GD&T. 

  • Very good experience in using Solidworks 

  • Good experience creating technical drawings for manufacturing and documentation 

  • Experienced working with third parties or internal parties on developing products for CE, ISO and EN 

  • Experience working with structural and stainless steel 

  • Excellent English verbal and written communication skills 

 

Nice to have: 

  • Experience in designing and manufacturing robotics parts 

  • Have practical experience and likes using your hands 

  • Experience in hydraulics 

  • Experience in a mechanical lead position 

  • Experience in a R&D position as a mechanical engineer 

 

We offer: 

  • An attractive job in a small and agile team 

  • A workplace in an innovation hub in BETAFACTORY in South Habour, Copenhagen  

  • Responsibilities from day one and a big impact on how technology is developed 

  • A flexible workplace with a versatile team 

  • A team that takes pride and enjoys the craft that is engineering 

  • Opportunities to quickly grow personally and professionally in a fast-paced environment 

  • A great selection of snacks & refreshments on-site
